alert.note: Alert for City of Winchester; Clarke; Frederick; Rappahannock; Shenandoah; Warren (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 22 at 4:58PM EDT until June 22 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Shenandoah County in northwestern Virginia... Southeastern Frederick County in northwestern Virginia... Central Warren County in northwestern Virginia... Southwestern Clarke County in northwestern Virginia... Northern Rappahannock County in northwestern Virginia... The City of Winchester in northwestern Virginia... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 457 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Stephens City, or near Millwood Pike, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Winchester, Front Royal, Strasburg, Millwood Pike, Stephens City, Middletown, Fort Valley, Arco, Greenwood, Seven Fountains, Dilbeck, Riverton, Reliance, Armel, Karo, Glen Echo, Nineveh, Cedarville, Buckton and Riverside. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: City of Winchester; Clarke; Frederick; Rappahannock; Shenandoah; Warren
